ops.js:
showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:6}); // {Barret}
“There was this guy who studied
'Planetary Life' here.”{PAUSE}“He couldn't take things the way
they were, so he went to Midgar
to form AVALANCHE.”

showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:8}); // {Barret}
“Guess you could say this is
where AVALANCHE was born.”{PAUSE}“I always wanted to come here…
And finally…I made it.”

showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:10}); // {Barret}
“And then…?
I don't know what's going to happen,
now that there is no AVALANCHE…”

showWindowWithDialog({window:0, dialog:15}); // Elder Hargo
“I think Bugenhagen
has foreseen things.”{PAUSE}“About the Planet…
About Nanaki…
And, about himself…”{PAUSE}“But, Bugenhagen would never
say that.
All he says is 'Ho Ho Hoooo'…”

showWindowWithDialog({window:0, dialog:14}); // Elder Hargo
“Mm…oh, this?
This is the Book of Stars.
I'm just finishing it.”{PAUSE}“Nothing is meaningless.
If I do this then, someday,
someone will run across it.”{PAUSE}“The Ancients did the same.
That is how we know about them, right?
Maybe even my book also…”

showWindowWithDialog({window:0, dialog:13}); // Elder Hargo
“Ahh, here it is.”{PAUSE}“My job is to gather all the
legends and the knowledge of the Planet
and to make a book.”{PAUSE}“Then, even when I return to the Planet,
the children may still be
taught about many things…”

showWindowWithDialog({window:0, dialog:13}); // Elder Hargo
“Ahh, here it is.”{PAUSE}“My job is to gather all the
legends and the knowledge of the Planet
and to make a book.”{PAUSE}“Then, even when I return to the Planet,
the children may still be
taught about many things…”

showWindowWithDialog({window:0, dialog:2}); // Elder Hargo
“Mmm? Oh, we have guests.
Good, good.”

showWindowWithDialog({window:0, dialog:4}); // Elder Hargo
“…The Promised Land.
So what do you want to know?”{PAUSE}“There is no one place called
the Promised Land.
That's what I believe.”{PAUSE}“No, no, it does exist.
Hmmm…you can say that.”{PAUSE}“In other words,
it doesn't exist for us,
but it did for the Ancients.”{PAUSE}“The Promised Land is the
resting place of the Ancients.”{PAUSE}“The life of the Ancients is one continuous
journey. A journey to grow trees and plants,
raise animals, and make Mako energy.”{PAUSE}“Their harsh journey continued throughout
their lives…”{PAUSE}“The place they returned to after
their long journey…
Their burial land is the Promised Land.”{PAUSE}“Huh? Supreme Happiness?
I believe that, for the Ancients,
it was the moment that they were
able to return to their Planet,”{PAUSE}“That moment when they were released
from their fate, and gained their
supreme happiness…”{PAUSE}“At least that's what I believe.
I really don't know whether or
not it's true.”

showWindowWithDialog({window:0, dialog:5}); // Elder Hargo
“Oh, that's not what you're here for?”{PAUSE}“I'd appreciate it if you didn't talk
about such foolish things as
legends and old wives tales.”

showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:12}); // “By the way, those that came
with you are all
at the Cosmo Candle.”{PAUSE}“Are you leaving?”

showWindowWithDialog({window:0, dialog:4}); // Elder Hargo

showWindowWithDialog({window:0, dialog:5}); // Elder Hargo
“Oh, that's not what you're here for?”{PAUSE}“I'd appreciate it if you didn't talk
about such foolish things as
legends and old wives tales.”

showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:12}); // “By the way, those that came

at the Cosmo Candle.”{PAUSE}“Are you leaving?”

showWindowWithDialog({window:0, dialog:1}); // Elder Hargo
“Where did I put it?
I know it's around here…”

dialogStrings:
Elder Hargo
“Where did I put it?
I know it's around here…”

Elder Hargo
“Mmm? Oh, we have guests.
Good, good.”

Elder Hargo
“I know, I know.”{PAUSE}“You came to ask me something, right?
Am I right?”
{CHOICE}It's about the Promised Land
{CHOICE}Not really

Elder Hargo
“…The Promised Land.
So what do you want to know?”{PAUSE}“There is no one place called
the Promised Land.
That's what I believe.”{PAUSE}“No, no, it does exist.
Hmmm…you can say that.”{PAUSE}“In other words,
it doesn't exist for us,
but it did for the Ancients.”{PAUSE}“The Promised Land is the
resting place of the Ancients.”{PAUSE}“The life of the Ancients is one continuous
journey. A journey to grow trees and plants,
raise animals, and make Mako energy.”{PAUSE}“Their harsh journey continued throughout
their lives…”{PAUSE}“The place they returned to after
their long journey…
Their burial land is the Promised Land.”{PAUSE}“Huh? Supreme Happiness?
I believe that, for the Ancients,
it was the moment that they were
able to return to their Planet,”{PAUSE}“That moment when they were released
from their fate, and gained their
supreme happiness…”{PAUSE}“At least that's what I believe.
I really don't know whether or
not it's true.”

Elder Hargo
“Oh, that's not what you're here for?”{PAUSE}“I'd appreciate it if you didn't talk
about such foolish things as
legends and old wives tales.”

{Barret}
“There was this guy who studied
'Planetary Life' here.”{PAUSE}“He couldn't take things the way
they were, so he went to Midgar
to form AVALANCHE.”

{Barret}
“Guess you could say this is
where AVALANCHE was born.”{PAUSE}“I always wanted to come here…
And finally…I made it.”

{Barret}
“And then…?
I don't know what's going to happen,
now that there is no AVALANCHE…”

“By the way, those that came
with you are all
at the Cosmo Candle.”{PAUSE}“Are you leaving?”

Elder Hargo
“Ahh, here it is.”{PAUSE}“My job is to gather all the
legends and the knowledge of the Planet
and to make a book.”{PAUSE}“Then, even when I return to the Planet,
the children may still be
taught about many things…”

Elder Hargo
“Mm…oh, this?
This is the Book of Stars.
I'm just finishing it.”{PAUSE}“Nothing is meaningless.
If I do this then, someday,
someone will run across it.”{PAUSE}“The Ancients did the same.
That is how we know about them, right?
Maybe even my book also…”

Elder Hargo
“I think Bugenhagen
has foreseen things.”{PAUSE}“About the Planet…
About Nanaki…
And, about himself…”{PAUSE}“But, Bugenhagen would never
say that.
All he says is 'Ho Ho Hoooo'…”
